original_solution_mapping.L1: Mike is using 40 blocks / 2 = <<40/2=20>>20 blocks of type B.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He uses in total 40 blocks + 20 blocks = <<40+20=60>>60 blocks of type A and B.
original_solution_mapping.L3: So he is going to use 150 blocks - 60 blocks = <<150-60=90>>90 blocks of other types.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 1126.
    Returns: the number of bricks of other types Mike is going to use.
    """
    # L1
    bricks_type_A = 40 # at least 40 bricks of type A
    half_divisor = 2 # half that many
    bricks_type_B = bricks_type_A / half_divisor

    # L2
    total_bricks_A_B = bricks_type_A + bricks_type_B

    # L3
    total_bricks_needed = 150 # In total, he needs to use 150 bricks
    other_types_bricks = total_bricks_needed - total_bricks_A_B

    # FA
    answer = other_types_bricks
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Mike is using {bricks_type_A} blocks / {half_divisor} = <<{bricks_type_A}/{half_divisor}={bricks_type_B}>>{bricks_type_B} blocks of type B.
He uses in total {bricks_type_A} blocks + {bricks_type_B} blocks = <<{bricks_type_A}+{bricks_type_B}={total_bricks_A_B}>>{total_bricks_A_B} blocks of type A and B.
So he is going to use {total_bricks_needed} blocks - {total_bricks_A_B} blocks = <<{total_bricks_needed}-{total_bricks_A_B}={other_types_bricks}>>{other_types_bricks} blocks of other types.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: So he is going to use 150 blocks - 22 blocks = <<150-22=128>>128 blocks of other types.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'half_divisor' (2) was used instead of 'bricks_type_A' (40).
